what: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
text: Performs Gibbs sampling routine sparse latent class model described Chen et al. (2020) <doi: 10.1007/s11336-019-09693-2>

title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
code: slcm(   y,   k,   burnin = 1000L,   chain_length = 10000L,   psi_invj = c(1, rep(2, 2^k - 1)),   m0 = 0,   bq = 1 )

title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
text: y Item Matrix k Dimension estimate Q matrix burnin Amount Draws Burn chain_length Number Iterations chain. psi_invj, m0, bq Additional tuning parameters.

title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
text: slcm object containing three named lists: estimates beta: Average beta coefficients theta: Average theta coefficients delta: Average activeness coefficients class: Average class membership pi: Average attribute class probability. omega: Average omega q: Average activeness Q matrix entries based heuristic transformation. m2ll: Average negative two times log-likelihood chain theta: theta coefficients iterations beta:  beta coefficients iterations class:  class membership iterations pi:  attribute class probability iterations omega:  omega iterations m2ll: Negative two times log-likelihood iterations details n: Number Subjects j: Number Items k: Number Traits l1: Slab parameter m0, bq: Additional tuning parameters burnin: Number Iterations discard chain_length: Number Iterations keep runtime: Duration model run inside C++ code. (include summarization MCMC chain.) package_version: Version package SLCM model fit . date_time: Date Time model fit.

title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
text: estimates list contains mean information sampling procedure. Meanwhile, chain list contains full MCMC values. Lastly, details list provides information regarding estimation call.

title: Sparse Latent Class Model for Cognitive Diagnosis (SLCM) — slcm
code: # Use a demo data set from the paper if(requireNamespace("edmdata", quietly = TRUE)) {   data("items_matrix_reasoning", package = "edmdata")      burnin = 50        # Set for demonstration purposes, increase to at least 1,000 in practice.   chain_length = 100 # Set for demonstration purposes, increase to at least 10,000 in practice.        model_reasoning = slcm(items_matrix_reasoning, k = 4,                           burnin = burnin, chain_length = chain_length) }
